medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced his first attack of paralysis at age 13, waking up with weakness in all extremities that disappeared within several hours. He noted grip, leg, and eyelid myotonia starting at age 25. Paralytic attacks occurred recurrently, particularly in winter, each lasting several hours. Weakness was often worse after rest, with alleviation noted with repeated exercise. No symptoms were experienced while living in Thailand.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Clear familial occurrence of symptoms; previously experienced improved strength with potassium loading.
medical_history.family_history: The patient's father experienced similar symptoms, specifically stiffness and inability to walk after warming legs in winter. The grandfather and other relatives also had symptoms, with myotonic eyelid lag noted. Symptoms gradually faded with age.
